title: What are the exact probabilities of winning for the two players, red and green, in the ‘first to forty points’ game described in the comments? - Quora

response.answer_text: From the comment: A spinner, or eight-sided die, is thrown which has exactly 5 red faces and 3 green faces, each face is equally likely to be chosen on each spin. The die is thrown repeatedly. On each throw, if a red face results then Red is awarded 2 points; if a green face results then Green is awarded 4 points. Both Red and Green start with no points and the game finishes when the first of the players reaches 40 points. The player that does so is the winner.
